abstract: Talks between the two airlines have stumbled over which share prices to use in their proposed stock-for-stock merger.
snippet: Talks between the two airlines have stumbled over which share prices to use in their proposed stock-for-stock merger.
lead_paragraph: 6:17 p.m. | Updated Merger talks between United Airlines and Continental Airlines reached an impasse over the weekend over a disagreement about the price of a stock-for-stock deal, people involved in the negotiations told DealBook.

headline.main: United-Continental Talks Said to Snag Over Price

byline.original: By Andrew Ross Sorkin and Michael J. de la Merced
